title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Wed Apr 4, 2018 | 2:05pm   
A Palestinian holds a fire during clashes with Israeli troops at Israel-Gaza border, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa   Palestinian holds a fire during clashes with Israeli troops at Israel-Gaza border, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close 1 / 27 
Attendees are seen during a silent march and rally on the National Mall to mark the 50th anniversary of the assassination of civil rights leader Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. in Washington. REUTERS/Eric Thayer Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 Attendees are seen during a silent march and rally on the National Mall to mark the 50th anniversary of the assassination of civil rights leader Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. in Washington. REUTERS/Eric Thayer Close 2 / 27 
Presidents Hassan Rouhani of Iran, Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey and Vladimir Putin of Russia pose before their meeting in Ankara, Turkey. Tolga Bozoglu/Pool via Reuters Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 Presidents Hassan Rouhani of Iran, Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey and Vladimir Putin of Russia pose before their meeting in Ankara, Turkey. Tolga Bozoglu/Pool via Reuters Close 3 / 27 
Border patrol agents apprehend immigrants who illegally crossed the border from Mexico into the U.S. in the Rio Grande Valley sector, near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Loren Elliott Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 Border patrol agents apprehend immigrants who illegally crossed the border from Mexico into the U.S. in the Rio Grande Valley sector, near McAllen, Texas. REUTERS/Loren Elliott Close 
Artists perform during the opening ceremony of the Commonwealth Games in Australia. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 Artists perform during the opening ceremony of the Commonwealth Games in Australia. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Close 
A shark swims near a police boat. South Australia Police/via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 A shark swims near a police boat. South Australia Police/via REUTERS Close 6 / 27 
A squirrel sits on the floor after its limb amputation surgery at Aydin University in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Osman Orsal   squirrel sits on the floor after its limb amputation surgery at Aydin University in Istanbul, Turkey. REUTERS/Osman Orsal Close 7 / 27 
Alex van der Zwaan goes through security at the U.S. District Court after arriving for his sentencing in Washington, D.C. REUTERS/Leah Millis  lex van der Zwaan goes through security at the U.S. District Court after arriving for his sentencing in Washington, D.C. REUTERS/Leah Millis Close 8 / 27 
Central American migrants wait in line to receive food as they take a break from traveling in their caravan, during their journey to the U.S., in Matias Romero, Mexico. REUTERS/Henry Romero   Central American migrants wait in line to receive food as they take a break from traveling in their caravan, during their journey to the U.S., in Matias Romero, Mexico. REUTERS/Henry Romero Close 9 / 27 
Teachers pack the state Capitol rotunda to capacity, on the second day of a teacher walkout, to demand higher pay and more funding for education, in Oklahoma City. REUTERS/Nick Oxford   Teachers pack the state Capitol rotunda to capacity, on the second day of a teacher walkout, to demand higher pay and more funding for education, in Oklahoma City. REUTERS/Nick Oxford Close 10 / 27 
Police officers and crime scene tape are seen at Youtube headquarters following an active shooter situation in San Bruno, California. REUTERS/Elijah Nouvelage   Police officers and crime scene tape are seen at Youtube headquarters following an active shooter situation in San Bruno, California. REUTERS/Elijah Nouvelage Close 11 / 27 
Divers train at the Aquatic Center located in the Gelora Bung Karno sports complex, the main venue for the upcoming Asian Games 2018 in Jakarta, Indonesia. REUTERS/Darren Whiteside   Divers train at the Aquatic Center located in the Gelora Bung Karno sports complex, the main venue for the upcoming Asian Games 2018 in Jakarta, Indonesia. REUTERS/Darren Whiteside Close 12 / 27 
Jerry Coleman (R), a forklift operator by day, takes pictures while he films a scene for his Youtube movie "All Lives Matter" with his friends at the Lorraine Motel, where civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. was shot and killed in 1968 in... more   Jerry Coleman (R), a forklift operator by day, takes pictures while he films a scene for his Youtube movie "All Lives Matter" with his friends at the Lorraine Motel, where civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. was shot and killed in 1968 in Memphis, Tennessee. REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst Close 13 / 27 
A sauropod footprint discovered at Brothers' Point on the Isle of Skye in Scotland. Jon Hoad/Edinburgh University/via REUTERS   sauropod footprint discovered at Brothers' Point on the Isle of Skye in Scotland. Jon Hoad/Edinburgh University/via REUTERS Close 14 / 27 
French CRS riot police pursue protesters, during a demonstration by French state-owned railway company SNCF workers and students, in Paris, as part of a nationwide strike, France. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes   French CRS riot police pursue protesters, during a demonstration by French state-owned railway company SNCF workers and students, in Paris, as part of a nationwide strike, France. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes Close 15 / 27 
The Palm Sunday procession makes its way towards a government-sanctioned church in Youtong village, Hebei province, China. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj   The Palm Sunday procession makes its way towards a government-sanctioned church in Youtong village, Hebei province, China. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj Close 16 / 27 
Detained Reuters journalist Wa Lone is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Ann Wang Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 Detained Reuters journalist Wa Lone is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Ann Wang Close 17 / 27 
A supporter of Ukraine's far-right parties and movements eats a lollipop as she attends a protest against oligarchs in Kiev, Ukraine. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich   supporter of Ukraine's far-right parties and movements eats a lollipop as she attends a protest against oligarchs in Kiev, Ukraine. REUTERS/Gleb Garanich Close 18 / 27 
Palestinian activists are seen reflected in a mirror as they gather at the Israel-Gaza border, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa   Palestinian activists are seen reflected in a mirror as they gather at the Israel-Gaza border, in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close 19 / 27 
Brazilian Marine patrols the Botafogo neighbourhood with Sugarloaf Mountain in the background in Rio de Janeiro. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes   Brazilian Marine patrols the Botafogo neighbourhood with Sugarloaf Mountain in the background in Rio de Janeiro. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes Close 20 / 27 
A girl walks on a pavement as she sells inflated balloons on the outskirts of Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey   girl walks on a pavement as she sells inflated balloons on the outskirts of Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey Close 21 / 27 
Forensic investigators examine the pavement and carriageway   Forensic investigators examine the pavement and carriageway   22 / 27 
  23 / 27 
Brazilian marines patrol the streets of Botafogo neighborhood with Sugar Loaf mountain on background in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes   Brazilian marines patrol the streets of Botafogo neighborhood with Sugar Loaf mountain on background in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes Close 24 / 27 
Central American migrants take part in a march along a street in the city as they take a pause from traveling in their caravan, during their journey to the U.S., in Matias Romero, Mexico. REUTERS/Henry Romero   Central American migrants take part in a march along a street in the city as they take a pause from traveling in their caravan, during their journey to the U.S., in Matias Romero, Mexico. REUTERS/Henry Romero Close 25 / 27 
A man trains his horse in an open ground on the outskirts of Ahmedabad, India. REUTERS/Amit Dave   man trains his horse in an open ground on the outskirts of Ahmedabad, India. REUTERS/Amit Dave Close 26 / 27 
People tend to a grave at Babaoshan Cemetery ahead of Qingming Festival, or Tomb Sweeping Day, in Beijing, China. REUTERS/Thomas Peter Reuters / Wednesday, April 04, 2018 People tend to a grave at Babaoshan Cemetery ahead of Qingming Festival, or Tomb Sweeping Day, in Beijing, China. REUTERS/Thomas Peter Close
